name: Southern Palms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from 21st - 28th April.
reviews.title: Location + friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a large balcony and overlooked the ocean and gardens. All facilities worked well, and the rum and coke waiting in the room was a boon.
reviews.title: Great holiday
Loved the Southern Palms
reviews.text: This hotel is located on arguably the best beach in Barbados. We watched the turtles swimming and they even joined us on our morning swim sometimes,

reviews.title: Another Beautiful Day in Barbados
reviews.text: We generally ate out, but we did enjoy the buffet breakfast on the Saturday we left. The bar is a friendly place, although the ICC Cricket World Cup may have influenced the trade during our stay.
The 'Gap' on which the hotel is situated contains bars, pubs, clubs, convenience stores etc. in abundance and feels a safe place to be.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to go back!

likes.liked: — Beach, and easy access to all parts of Barbados

reviews.text: We just came back from two weeks in Barbados and stayed one week at the Southern Palms. This was our seventh visit to Barbados but the first time at the Southern Palms. Here are some of our feeback:
reviews.title: Enjoyed it but...
A week of paradise!
reviews.text: Positive:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Beautiful Beach. We have been to many beaches in Barbados and I would say this is the best one for swimming. You don't get pounded by the waves (like we did when we stayed at Bougainvilla). It's a good beach for kids as well.
reviews.title: Two weeks of paradise.

likes.liked: — The space and comfort of a suite, some ocean view rooms were ok tough
likes.disliked: — Room only garden view was tiny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Fantastic location. You can walk to many restaurants. We tried the Restaurant at Southsea (next door) and it was fantastic. It's pricey but I highly recommend it. I also recommend Josef (also in the Gap) and Acqua (new Restaurant in Hastings).
reviews.title: Wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Good friendly staff.
reviews.title: Not bad at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an ocean view suite at the Southern Palms for 2 weeks, we liked the hotel and ate lunch there nearly everyday, the food was good and the prices were not bad, we had a apartment which had a kitchen with a balcony overlooking the small pool also another balcony on the roof which had sunbeds if you wanted to sunbathe, this overlooked the beach and the front of the property overlooking the little shops across the street, we hired a car for a couple of days it cost about £100, drove all around the island (the road directions are terrible) got lost several times! but got to see how the real bajans live! also did the wildlife park and a plantation house which we enjoyed, there are not a lot of shops in barbados so in the evening it revolves around dining out for meals, then back to the hotel for any entertainment, all in all we had a very nice time the beaches are beautiful, although the sea was very rough most of the time, you need to go up the coast nearer to Holetown or Speightstown for calmer waters, St Lawrence gap is by far apart from Bridgetown the most lively place in the evenings, but don't expect lots of bars and clubs, just good restaurants.
reviews.title: Liked

reviews.text: This hotel (beach club) is much better than it first appears. Barbados is an outstanding Caribbean island with a whole range of things to see and do; not to mention the wonderful scenery, beaches and unspoilt ocean views.
reviews.title: A truly calm and relaxed place

likes.liked: — Location on beach, opportunity to relax, quality of customer service
likes.disliked: — Locals trying to sell their Aloe Vera to you on the beach - just be friendly to them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has some of the friendliest members of staff I have had the pleasure to meet. Staff will go out of their way to help you and always smile and say hello.
reviews.title: Loved Southern Palms, Loved The Gap!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of the rooms is also good. They are much larger than you would need or expect. Standard rooms also have a kitchen surface, kettle, fridge and extensive shelving. The rooms are cleaned daily, to a high standard.
reviews.title: So Happy To Be Back

reviews.text: The wonderful location means that the hotel is literally on the beach at St Lawrence Gap. It's amazing. Drinks and food can also be taken onto the beach if you so wish.
reviews.title: Great location!

likes.disliked: — the time it took to get served sometimes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Been here 3 times now for two weeks at a time. Simply fantastic. It is simple, but what more do you need? Super location smack on the beach. 5 mins walk down to St Lawrence Gap for restaurants and bars. Food at the hotel is simple bajan cuisine but excellent. Friendly staff, clean, large basic rooms. Don't go for the half board option. Nothing wrong with the food at all but so many good places to eat nearby. Personal favourite is Cafe Sol 5 mins walk away for great value mexican dishes. Harlequins Restaurant (formerly Masquerade) is also very good for a more a la carte meal. A must do is Oistins Fish-Fry on a Friday night. BBQ'd fish, chicken, rice & peas!
reviews.title: Everytime

reviews.text: Pop into Divi Southwinds' (hotel next door) beach bar at 5pm for happy hour. Then to Southern Palms beach bar happy hour 6-7.
reviews.title: Good family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're there for 2 Fridays then do Bubbas. It's a sportsbar in Worthing $2BDS bus trip or $10BDS taxi. Great food and Friday night 5-8 is 241 on all drinks.
reviews.title: another wonderful holiday at SP

likes.liked: — Our suite and the hotel location

reviews.title: A good alternative for the Casuarina
reviews.text: Go! Now! Book it! Take me!

This was the third of four hotels we stayed at in Barbados. It was unplanned and spontaneous because the one we had booked, the Divi Southwinds, turned out to be a dive. The Southern Palms was right next door and the grounds looked nice and they had a room available. It was our kids favorite hotel on our trip (we also stayed at another in St Lucia). The hotel has a parrot, fish and lots of resident cats. In addition the water sporst center has sand toys, floaty toys, balls and boogie boards for kids. THere is miniture golf and a lovely beach. The beach is frequented by turtles, and my husband and son managed to snorkel with them one morning when the water was calm. This beach does tend to have larger surf than Rockley or the West Coast beaches. The room itself was pretty basic, although large. The paint was sloppy and furnishings spartan, but the balcony was great. THe location on the beach and on the St Lawrence Gap was excellent. Good restaurants nearby were Harlequin and if you're up for an expensive meal the Restaurant at the South Seas was top notch.
reviews.title: Good but...............

aka: Southern Palms Hotel St Lawrence Gap
